intro: Humboltia ciliata, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the western coast of the United States and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or coastal soils, often in areas with high salinity and wind exposure. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped with finely toothed edges, and it has a trailing growth habit that makes it suitable for coastal gardens. Humboltia ciliata is adapted to thrive in harsh coastal environments, showcasing its resilience to salt spray and strong winds.
